title: Do you think singers sing their own songs when they're alone? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, definitely! I had a few songs hidden that I sing a lot. I mean some musicians probably had the melodies stuck in their head even before the it is made into an actual song. It also helps me improve my song better. For example like when I sing the bridge part, I don't really like the sound when I sing it, then I can improve so when I write a new one, I know what I can work on.

No, I think the opposite is true. Singers when alone would try to sing song of other singers so as to enhance vocals and learning related to other songs. Once sung a particular song perfectly, it's important to switch on to the difficult songs. Further it may vary from singer to singer😊.
Definitely ! Once you start making your own music it’s almost impossible to not sing your own songs throughout the day. Especially when you like to critique yourself.
The only reason I sing my own songs is to practice for a performance. I never sing my own songs for fun. I wrote them and I’m done with them! On to the next…
